pageSubtitle: Learn and develop your knowledge of HashiCorp Cloud Platform with these tutorials and code resources.

cards.title: Quick Start
cards.description: It only takes a few minutes to get started with HashiCorp Cloud Platform on your local development environment.

cards.title: App Lifecycle
cards.description: HashiCorp Cloud Platform has an opinionated view on the minimum application lifecycle: build, deploy, and release.

cards.title: Projects
cards.description: A project contains one or more applications and each one in a project represents a single deployable object.

cards.title: waypoint.hcl
cards.description: The waypoint.hcl file configures each HashiCorp Cloud Platform project and defines how HashiCorp Cloud Platform builds, deploys, and releases it.

cards.title: Overview
cards.description: HashiCorp Cloud Platform can configure your application by setting environment variables and writing files.

cards.title: Dynamic Values
cards.description: HashiCorp Cloud Platform can sync app config values with external systems like Kubernetes ConfigMaps, HashiCorp Vault, and more.

cards.title: Files
cards.description: HashiCorp Cloud Platform can write configs to files for apps that expect configurations at a certain path or in a certain format.

cards.title: Logs
cards.description: HashiCorp Cloud Platform app logs are aggregated and available to view via the CLI and UI.

cards.title: Exec
cards.description: HashiCorp Cloud Platform enables you to execute commands in the context of a deployed application.

cards.title: HashiCorp Cloud Platform URL Service
cards.description: The HashiCorp Cloud Platform URL service is a free, public service hosted by HashiCorp to view your deployed app.

cards.title: HashiCorp Cloud Platform Runners
cards.description: HashiCorp Cloud Platform has three types of runners to execute every operation: CLI, remote, and on-demand.

cards.title: HashiCorp Cloud Platform Triggers
cards.description: Trigger URLs are pre-configured HashiCorp Cloud Platform lifecycle operations for execution inside CI environments.
